16.m: And as they continued to ask him, he stood up and said to them, 'Let him who is without sin among you be the first to throw a stone at her.' - John 8:7 (ESV)

l.q: From the Bible reading, who is the sinner?
l.a: Initially, from the perspective of the scribes and the Pharisees, only the adulterous woman was the sinner. But Jesus made them realize that even they are sinners.

l.q: Instead of following the scribes and the Pharisees, what did Jesus do?
l.a: Jesus did not condemn the adulterous woman but He let her go and reminded her to sin no more. He forgave her of her sins.

l.q: Can you think of other Bible verses that talk about us being sinners as well?
l.a: There is a lot, but Ecclesiastes 7:20 (ESV) says, 'Surely there is not a righteous man on earth who does good and never sins.'.

16.p: Lord Jesus, I am sorry for the sins I have done, even for those that I may not even be aware of. Help me to live a life that is pleasing to you. Just as you came into the world to forgive us our sins, I pray that you will grant me the grace to also forgive those who sinned against me.
